title: Exercise: Create a Custom Transformer For Parallel Processing

questions.question: Why did we initially choose to create the custom transformer after the PointOnAreaOverlayer?
options: Overlayer transformers cannot be included in custom transformers.
We did not want more than one input port in our custom transformer.
We needed the POSTCODE attribute to create parallel processing groups.
We wanted to limit the number of features entering the custom transformer.

questions.question: Why would using all six characters of the POSTCODE attribute be suboptimal?
options: It would generate few groups, each with a small number of features.
It would generate few groups, each with a large number of features.
It would generate many groups, each with a small number of features.
It would generate many groups, each with a large number of features.

questions.question: What transformer can you use to get around the fact you cannot include readers in custom transformers?
What worker processes can you look for in the Task Manager to see if FME is using parallel processing?
Removing the FeatureReader from the BuildingValidator and instead of connecting it to the BuildingValidator with a new Input port results in faster translations.
